origination.corpname: University of Michigan. Office of Financial Aid.

did.unittitle: Office of Financial Aid (University of Michigan) records 1954-2000 1977-1996
did.abstract: The Office of Financial Aid at the University of Michigan administers need- and merit-based financial support programs for students. The records include topical files detailing the operations of the office, its interactions with other university units and groups, and outside activities, as well as federal funding reports and applications and information on alumni scholarships.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

did.physloc: Portions located in offsite storage; prior notification required for access.

acqinfo.p: The record group (donor. no. 8672) was received in several accessions beginning in 1997.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Office of Financial Aid (University of Michigan) Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Office of Financial Aid at the University of Michigan administers need- and merit-based financial support programs for students. While provision of financial support to students began very early in the history of the university, it was not until 1962 that a discrete financial aid office was established, as part of a new, comprehensive administrative structure for student affairs that replaced the Dean of Men and Dean of Women. Walter Rea, previously Dean of Men, was named Director of Student Financial Aids that year, in addition to serving as assistant to the vice president of student affairs.

In 1968-69, the office and its operations were reorganized to reflect the increased need for centralized record keeping and computerization. The policy of packaging aid, developing an individualized program of loans, grants and work for each student, was introduced at that time, as was the College Work-Study program. Ronald Brown led the reorganization effort and was named director in January 1969 when Rea retired. The office was moved within the organizational structure of the university as well, reporting to the Vice President for Academic Affairs rather than the Vice President for Student Affairs. Prior to the early 1970s, the office was referred to as the Office of Financial Aids or the Office of Student Financial Aid, until settling on its current name around 1972.

The operations of the Office of Financial Aid have become increasingly complex in the years since. The Office of Financial Aid coordinates and administers the university's participation in three major federal government aid programs: Perkins Loans, College Work-Study, and the Federal Supplemental Education Opportunity Grant (FSEOG) program. The office is also responsible for many need- and merit-based scholarships, loans, and grants for undergraduate students. For graduate students, the office administers federal loan and work-study programs only. Most of the graduate schools and colleges have student support offices that administer scholarships and aid programs designed specifically for their own students.
For current information on the Office of Financial Aid and its programs, consult their website at: http://www.finaid.umich.edu/.

chronitem.event: Walter Rea (Assistant to the Vice President and Director of Student Financial Aids)

scopecontent.p: The University of Michigan Office of Financial Aid record group consists of five series: Office of Financial Aid, University of Michigan, Outside Activities, Federal Funding Reports and Applications and Alumni Scholarships. Several accessions were brought together at the time of processing. The files include material mainly from three directors of the office, Tom Butts, Harvey Grotrian, and Judith Harper, as well as from several subordinate departments and staff. A small amount of older material from a predecessor office, the Office of Scholarships (which reported to the Dean of Men), is also included.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.corpname: University of Michigan. Office of Financial Aid.
controlaccess.subject: Student aid--Michigan.

scopecontent.p: The Office of Financial Aid series, 1954-1999 (5.5 linear feet), contains topical files that include information about the policies, procedures, and operations of the office and its departments. The policy files are particularly useful, as they detail the development and implementation of various policies and programs. The series also includes a small amount of historical information about the Office of Scholarships, a predecessor to the Office of Financial Aid.

did.unittitle: Health Professions and Nursing Student Loan and Scholarship Programs 1977
Financial Aid Model (from Office of Financial Analysis) 1982
Survey of Directors of Aid and Presidents 1980
Douglas McGreeham and Edward Siwik Scholarships 1982-1983
University of Michigan Club of Greater Philadelphia 1986
Wade H. McCree, Jr. Incentive Scholarship Program 1987
Office of Scholarships (predecessor to Office of Financial Aid) 1954-1962
Emergency Student Loans to Graduate Teaching Assistants 1983-1988
Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) 1978-1983
Terms of Agreement, Department of Health, Education and Welfare (HEW) 1973-1985
Department of Education Experimental Sites Program 1995-1996
Minority Participation in Study Abroad Programs 1970-1972
Reauthorization of Higher Education Act Impact Assessment 1992-1993

scopecontent.p: The University of Michigan series, 1957-1994 (2 linear feet), documents the Office of Financial Aid’s interactions and collaboration with other university units. The series includes information on a number of university committees related to financial aid, as well as correspondence with individual schools and colleges. Of particular relevance to the record group is material from the Financial Aid Advisory Committee.

did.unittitle: Center for the Continuing Education of Women 1971-1987
Coalition on the Use of Learning Skills (CULS) 1976-1983

scopecontent.p: The Outside Activities series, 1974-1994 (0.5 linear feet), includes information on the office's participation and cooperation with groups and initiatives outside the University of Michigan. Most of the series relates to state-level organizations and projects, though a small amount of information on federal student loans, a major area of interest of Tom Butts (the office's director from 1971-1977), is also included.

did.unittitle: Coalition for Coordination of Student Financial Aid
Department of Health, Education and Welfare Region V Evaluation 1974-1975
Educator's Conference (sponsored by Congressmen Dingell and Ford) 1984-1994
Governor's Commission on the Future of Higher Education 1984-1985
Michigan Postsecondary Admissions and Financial Assistance Handbook 1982-1983

scopecontent.p: The Federal Funding Reports and Applications series, 1969-1993 (1 linear foot), is comprised mainly of applications, reports and supporting material for the Fiscal Operations Report and Application to Participate (FISAP), documentation which must be filed with the U.S. Department of Education each year in order for the university to receive federal funding for financial aid. The series also includes authorization and allocation notifications and separate applications for health professions funding.

did.unittitle: Fiscal Operations Report and Application to Participate (FISAP)

scopecontent.p: The Alumni Scholarships series, 1954-2000 (1 linear foot), includes information on student scholarships and loan programs administered by the Alumni Association, as well as related initiatives. The administration of a number of these was transferred to the Office of Financial Aid in 1995, along with the staff position that oversaw the programs. The series includes summary information on individual named scholarships as well as larger scholarship programs. A small amount of information on recruitment efforts is also included in the series.
